summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement (5270.09) establishing the Inmate Discipline Program, effective August 1, 2011. It outlines prohibited acts, sanctions, and procedures for disciplinary actions against inmates in BOP custody. The document includes significant changes such as establishing new prohibited acts for sexual assault (with and without force) and increasing severity levels for various offenses.

persons.name: Thomas R. Kane
persons.role: Acting Director, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Approved the Program Statement as the Acting Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Inmate Discipline Program Effective Date
events.description: The Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement 5270.09, Inmate Discipline Program, becomes effective.

events.title: Program Statement Issuance
events.description: Program Statement 5270.09 is issued, establishing the Inmate Discipline Program with updated prohibited acts and sanctions.

keyFacts: The document establishes a new Greatest severity level prohibited act (Code 114) for sexual assault involving the use or threat of force, and a High severity level act (Code 229) for sexual assault without the use or threat of force.
It increases the severity level of escapes from non-secure facilities from High to Greatest severity.
The policy applies to all persons in the custody of the Federal Bureau of Prisons or Bureau contract facilities, including sentenced and unsentenced inmates, detainees, and witnesses.
Greatest and High severity level prohibited acts (like sexual assault) cannot be informally resolved and must be referred to a Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO).
The document outlines a detailed disciplinary process including incident reports, investigations, Unit Discipline Committee (UDC) review, and DHO hearings, with specific rights for inmates.
